author: whittyuk
title: manners cost nothing
text: when i booked i had a pretty good idea what i would be getting. i had stayed in ibis budget before ( not this one) and i had been happy with what i paid for. rooms where clean and tidy and towels where fine. the bed wasnt very comfortable. the mattress was very thin. however, it was cheap for london and had free parking. my problem however was the staff. i hardly saw a smile amongst them. every hotel i have stayed in no matter the level the staff have smiled. i do not expect mardy house keepers with children in tow. grumpy reception staff who, it appeared had more important things to be doing than taking care of the customer. breakfast was a joke. rock hard pastries which appeared to have been microwaved and no meat for a continental buffet is just not acceptable. giving appologies is one thing but refunds and free nights is how to keep customers if they want to keep your business. plus i also had a valuable item of my luggage that went missing. i cant prove anything, but i have my suspicions. overall not impressed
